/wiki/Archery_at_the_1960_Summer_Paralym: Archery at the 1960 Summer Paralympics consisted of eight archery events , four for men and four for women .
/wiki/Ron_Stein: Ronald Arthur Ron Stein ( 27 September 1937 - 16 February 2010 ) was an American athlete who competed at the inaugural Summer Paralympic Games held in Rome in 1960 .
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1960_Summer_Paral: Athletics at the 1960 Summer Paralympics consisted of 25 events , 13 for men and 12 for women .
/wiki/Wayne_Broeren: Wayne Henry Broeren ( 2 March 1933 - 26 March 1991 ) from Champaign , Illinois , was a United States Paralympic athlete . In the 1960 Summer Paralympics , he competed in multiple sports including dartchery and wheelchair basketball . In the 1960 , he was a member of the winning United States wheelchair basketball team and one half of the pair that won the mixed dartchery , along with Jack Whitman . In 2004 he was posthumously honoured with a letter by his alma mater , the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign . FAMILY Wayne married Cecil Marie Creath . They had four children , Stuart , Rachel , Timothy and Thomas .
/wiki/Dartchery_at_the_1960_Summer_Paral: Dartchery at the 1960 Summer Paralympics consisted of a mixed pairs event .
/wiki/Swimming_at_the_1960_Summer_Paraly: Swimming at the 1960 Summer Paralympics consisted of 62 events , 32 for men and 30 for women . Each race had no more than three competitors so every swimmer completing a race was guaranteed a medal . All the swimmers successfully completed their races , and every swimmer at the Games therefore earned a medal .
/wiki/Wheelchair_basketball_at_the_1960_: Wheelchair basketball at the 1960 Summer Paralympics consisted of two men 's tournaments . One for athletes with complete lesion paraplegia , and one for athletes with incomplete paraplegia .
/wiki/Paul_Sones: Paul Dorrance Sones was a United States Paralympic athlete . In the first 1960 Summer Paralympics he competed and medaled in multiple sports including archery , swimming and wheelchair basketball .
/wiki/Saul_Welger: Saul Welger ( 18 April 1931 - 10 October 2002 ) from Brooklyn , New York , was a United States Paralympic athlete . In the 1960 Summer Paralympics and 1964 Summer Paralympics he competed in multiple sports , including wheelchair basketball . In the 1960 and 1964 Paralympics he was a member of the winning United States wheelchair basketball team . In 1976 , Welger was inducted into the NWBA Hall of Fame .
